The 2026 Grid

11 Teams. 22 Drivers. One Goal.

Ferrari

Base: Maranello, Italy
  • 16. Charles Leclerc
  • 44. Lewis Hamilton

The most successful team in history. With Hamilton joining, they have the strongest lineup on the grid.

McLaren

Base: Woking, UK
  • 4. Lando Norris
  • 81. Oscar Piastri

The reigning Constructor Champions. Their car is the benchmark for aerodynamics.

Red Bull Racing

Base: Milton Keynes, UK
  • 3. Max Verstappen
  • 6. Isack Hadjar

After a tough 2025, they are fighting back with their new Ford-powered engine.

Mercedes-AMG

Base: Brackley, UK
  • 63. George Russell
  • 12. Kimi Antonelli

A mix of experience and raw young talent. Antonelli is the rookie to watch.

Aston Martin

Base: Silverstone, UK
  • 14. Fernando Alonso
  • 18. Lance Stroll

Designed by Adrian Newey, this car is expected to be a title contender.

Audi F1 Team

Base: Hinwil, Switzerland
  • 27. Nico Hulkenberg
  • 10. Gabriel Bortoleto

The German giant enters F1 for the first time, taking over the old Sauber team.

Williams Racing

Base: Grove, UK
  • 23. Alexander Albon
  • 55. Carlos Sainz

A historic team on the rise with one of the best driver pairings in the midfield.

Alpine

Base: Enstone, UK
  • 10. Pierre Gasly
  • 43. Franco Colapinto

Representing France, they are looking to solve their engine reliability issues.

Racing Bulls

Base: Faenza, Italy
  • 30. Liam Lawson
  • 41. Arvid Linblad

Red Bull's sister team, now focusing on developing young Japanese talent.

Haas F1 Team

Base: Kannapolis, USA
  • 31. Esteban Ocon
  • 87. Oliver Bearman

The American underdog team known for doing a lot with a small budget.

Cadillac Andretti

Base: Fishers, USA
  • 11. Sergio Perez
  • 77. Valtteri Bottas

The 11th team! They bring massive GM support and two very experienced race winners.
